name: emacs-mcx
description: Emacs emulation for VSCode with multi-cursor support, clipboard-integrated kill-ring, well-emulated mark-mode, and more.

emacs-mcx.killRingMax.description: Maximum number of Kill Ring entries

emacs-mcx.markRingMax.description: Maximum number of Mark Ring entries

emacs-mcx.killWholeLine.description: Same to kill-whole-line variable in Emacs

emacs-mcx.strictEmacsMove.description: Overrides moveBeginningOfLineBehavior, moveEndOfLineBehavior, scrollUpCommandBehavior, and scrollDownCommandBehavior to be 'emacs' mode
emacs-mcx.strictEmacsMove.deprecationMessage: Deprecated: Please use fine grained configs instead such as emacs-mcx.moveBeginningOfLineBehavior, emacs-mcx.moveEndOfLineBehavior, emacs-mcx.scrollUpCommandBehavior, and emacs-mcx.scrollDownCommandBehavior.

emacs-mcx.clearSelectionBeforeCharMove.description: If true, forwardChar/backwardChar clear existing selections when mark mode is off (Emacs-like). If false, they follow VS Code behavior and collapse selections.

emacs-mcx.shiftSelectMode.description: Enable Shift Selection (Emacs shift-select-mode) for movement commands when holding the Shift key. Default is false to avoid `ctrl+shift+p` conflicts with the Command Palette on Windows/Linux.

emacs-mcx.moveBeginningOfLineBehavior.description: Simulate Emacs's cursor movements or preserve VSCode's native ones

emacs-mcx.moveEndOfLineBehavior.description: Simulate Emacs's cursor movements or preserve VSCode's native ones

emacs-mcx.scrollUpCommandBehavior.description: Simulate Emacs's cursor movements or preserve VSCode's native ones

emacs-mcx.scrollDownCommandBehavior.description: Simulate Emacs's cursor movements or preserve VSCode's native ones

emacs-mcx.wordNavigationStyle.description: Simulate Emacs's word boundary behavior or preserve VSCode's native one for forward/backward word and kill word commands

emacs-mcx.keepCursorInVisibleRange.description: If true, the cursor is kept in the visible range when scrolling up or down like Emacs.

emacs-mcx.emacsLikeTab.description: Simulate the original emacs's tab behavior.

emacs-mcx.useMetaPrefixAlt.description: If true, Alt key works as the Meta prefix.

emacs-mcx.useMetaPrefixEscape.description: If true, Escape key works as the Meta prefix.

emacs-mcx.useMetaPrefixCtrlLeftBracket.description: If true, ctrl+[ works as the Meta prefix.

emacs-mcx.useMetaPrefixMacCmd.description: If true, Command (âŒ˜) key works as the Meta prefix (macOS only).

emacs-mcx.cursorMoveOnFindWidget.description: If true, the find widget does not close when using cursor moving commands while this is different from the original Emacs' behavior.

emacs-mcx.enableOverridingTypeCommand.description: If true, overriding `type` command is enabled to use prefix arguments on character inputs by IME.

emacs-mcx.lineMoveVisual.description: When true, line-move moves point by visual lines (same as an Emacs variable line-move-visual).

emacs-mcx.debug.silent.description: If true, all logs are suppressed.

emacs-mcx.debug.loggingLevelForAlert.description: Maximum level of messages to present as VS Code information window.

emacs-mcx.debug.loggingLevelForConsole.description: Maximum level of messages to log to console. Logs are visible in developer tools.

commands.title: Emacs-MCX: Add Selection To Next Find Match
Emacs-MCX: Add Selection To Previous Find Match
Emacs-MCX: Replace Kill Ring To Rectangle
